intro: Solanum stellatiglandulosum, commonly known as the star-glandular nightshade, is a flowering plant species native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped glands on its stems and leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale purple, followed by berries that mature to a dark blue or black color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and research settings.
